content:
The full name of the installed application on the machine that concerns system health may vary depending on the specific version of Windows, as well as any additional software that may be installed on the machine. Some examples of applications that might be installed on a Windows machine that concern system health are:

* Performance Monitor (Perfmon.exe) : It's a built-in Windows tool that provides detailed information about the performance of various system components, such as CPU, memory, disk, and network usage.
* Windows Event Viewer (Eventvwr.msc) : It's a built-in Windows tool that allows you to view detailed information about system events, including warnings, errors, and critical events that may indicate a problem with the system's health.
* Task Manager (Taskmgr.exe) : It's a built-in Windows tool that provides information about the performance of running processes and services, as well as the overall health of the system.
* Windows Resource Monitor (Resmon.exe) : It's a built-in Windows tool that provides detailed information about the performance of various system resources, such as CPU, memory, disk, and network usage.
* Windows Security Center (Wscui.cpl) : It's a built-in Windows tool that provides information
